suffering from severe food deprivation.', 'Famished - Desperate for food, often used hyperbolically but literally means very hungry.', 'Hungry stomach - An expression indicating the feeling of hunger one experiences in their abdomen area.', 'Inadequately fed - Not sufficiently provided with nutrition.', 'Underfed - Receiving less food than necessary for proper growth or maintenance.', 'Deprived of food - Lacking access to sufficient amounts of food, leading to hunger.', 'Nutrient-deficient - Not having enough essential nutrients in the diet.', 'Fasting (when unintended) - Temporarily abstaining from eating by mistake or under undesirable circumstances.', 'Empty belly - A colloquial term indicating a lack of food, often used humorously to describe hunger pangs.', 'Goiter - An enlargement of the thyroid gland that can be related indirectly due to iodine deficiency caused by poor dietary intake.', "Vitamin deficiency - Lacking essential vitamines in one's diet, which could lead to various health issues including hunger symptoms.", 'Picky eater (can lead to hunger if not addressed) - A person who is very selective about what they eat and may end up with insufficient nutrition intake.', 'Food insecurity - The state of being without reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable, nutritious food.', 'Underfed child - An innocent but specific term referring to children who are not getting enough food for proper growth and development.', 'Unfulfilled appetite - A feeling or sensation of hunger that is unaddressed or ignored.', 'Empty pantry - Literally having no food in the pantry, indicative of being unable to provide meals.', "Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) - Describes someone's physical appearance when they are extremely thin due to severe hunger or malnutrition."]
